TextBlock.Text: SENNETTI: Thank you for aiding me in testing this, Ditylum. I believe it should work, but it is always best to do some manner of test.
DITYLUM: No problem, although I do want to ask what exactly we’re testing
SENNETTI: This recorder. I have modified it in such a way that it should be able to transcribe your spoken language in Nomai.
DITYLUM: Ah, alright! So, we just need to talk about something for a bit and make sure it’s picking me up properly?

SENNETTI: Precisely,. We just need a topic to talk about such that we generate a sufficiently large conversation. Let me see... Ah! I have always wondered Ditylum, what was that stone tablet that Okalis returned to you?

DITYLUM: Oh! Um, it’s honestly kinda embarrassing, but it’s a poem that I made for my partner, Lioloma. Turns out that she wanted to keep it, but I had accidentally left it at that camp and had to go back for it.
SENNETTI: That’s very sweet! I am sure you were quite flattered she valued it so highly.
DITYLUM: Yeah! I’m not the best writer, so it really meant a lot that she wanted to keep it. Was that all, or do we need to keep talking for a bit?

SENNETTI: I believe that should be sufficient. I will need to review the transcription to ensure its accuracy. Although... Would you allow me to borrow your poem? That is a type of text I have not yet encountered in your language, so it may aid in ensuring the accuracy of my translation.
